problem.markdown: >>How are experimental groups populated in a course with content experiments?<< (!) Learners are placed in a different randomized group each time they encounter a content experiment. (x) Learners are placed in a random group at the beginning of the course, and stay in the same group for every content experiment. ( ) Learners are placed in an experimental group based on a defined and limited set of criteria. They stay in that group for the whole class. ( ) Learners are placed in an experimental group based on a defined and limited set of criteria. Each experiment has a different set of criteria. [explanation] Grouping is always random, and you can reuse the same groups as many times as you like. For more detail, check out the edX documentation on content experiments. [explanation]
